page.title: 05PLANTING TREES IN HODGEMOOR
page.content: In 1973 it was Plant a Tree year and many schools in Bucks sent children to Hodgemoor Woods to help plant trees.In the Autumn of 1982 this was repeated and the 1st & 2nd year Middle School classes from Seer Green Combined School planted 50 beech trees.Each tree had a label with the child's name tied to it. The foresters had prepared the site and dug the holes.After planting,each 30 cm sapling was encased in wire netting to keep rabbits and deer away. Hodgemoor Woods offers a peaceful sett- ing for everyone to enjoy whether walk- ing or horse riding.Path and bridleways are marked clearly.Examples of byelaws: YOU MAY NOT GRAZE ANIMALS. YOU MAY NOT DISTURB OR REMOVE ANY HIST- ORICAL OR ARCHAEOLOGICAL REMAINS. YOU ARE NOT ALLOWED TO PICK FLOWERS. YOU ARE NOT ALLOWED TO LIGHT FIRES.
